Player History
Drafted in 6th round, 117th overall pick, by St. Louis in 1965...
Injured on 5/25/1965 with a Torn Rotator Cuff Muscle, out for entire career...
Drafted in 3rd round, 54th overall pick, by St. Louis in 1966...
Injured on 9/1/1967 with a Pulled Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Injured on 4/7/1970 with a Strained Bicep Tendon, out for 4 weeks...

Injured on 7/25/1970 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for 5 days...
Injured on 6/7/1972 with a Ruptured Tricep Tendon, out for 7 weeks...
Injured on 9/4/1972 with a Ruptured Bicep Tendon, out for 3-4 weeks...
Earned first career win on 7/28/1973...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/22/1976, winning 2 games with a 0.00 ERA...
Drafted in 2nd round, 33rd overall pick, by Cincinnati in 1985...
Injured on 6/28/1985 with a Sprained Ankle, out for 6 days...
Had first career hit (double) on 6/5/1989, off John Stuper (LA)...
Hit first career homerun on 7/12/1989, off Greg Mathews (HOU)...
Had 5 hits with 7 RBI against Philadelphia on 4/1/1993...
Signed as a free agent by Cleveland on 2/14/1995 to a 3-year deal worth $1,160,000 per year...
Had 5 hits with 7 RBI against California on 7/17/1995...
Was selected to the 1996 Allstar game...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Texas on 7/10/1997...
